## Amador County Board of Supervisors District 2
## Amador County Unified School District, District 4
## Amador County Unified School District, District 5
## Amador County, California, Measure Q, Road Improvement Sales Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall an ordinance be adopted authorizing a 3/4 cent (0.75%) sales tax on retail transactions in the unincorporated area of the County for a ten-year period, providing approximately $3.4 Million annually to be used solely for the repair, maintenance and improvement of local county roads?”
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
*This report provides an AI-assisted analysis of ballot complexity. Please note that this is a supplementary analysis and not a substitute for official election information.*
**This ballot is more complex than 54 percent of U.S. Ballots.**

“Shall an ordinance be adopted authorizing a 3/4 cent (0.75%) sales tax on retail transactions in the unincorporated area of the County for a ten-year period, providing approximately $3.4 Million annually to be used solely for the repair, maintenance and improvement of local county roads?”
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”

Estates Zone of Benefit, California, Measure M, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)', 'Walnut Drive Road Zone of Benefit, California, Measure C, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)']","['“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $1,000.00 on each parcel of land within the Blanchard Estates Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road, drainage, and landscape maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $12,000.00, be adopted?”', '“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”', '“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”', '“Raise Minimum Wage. Initiative Statute.[6]”', ""“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”"", '“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”', '“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”', '“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”', '“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”', '“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”', '“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”', '“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $350.00 on each parcel of land within the Cavalry Meadows Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for drainage maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $3,850.00, to replace the current benefit assessment of $110, be adopted?”', '“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 22 and refund levied special assessments?”', '“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 33 and refund levied special assessments?”', '“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 39 and refund levied special assessments?”', '“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $375.00, with an annual adjustment using the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers, on each parcel of land within the Emerald Meadows Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for drainage, street lighting, landscape maintenance, and wetland-related services and generating an annual revenue of approximately $41,625.00, be adopted?”', '“Shall the measure increasing the per parcel Hickok Road CSD special tax limit from $200 to $400 per year, resulting in a maximum annual income of $24,800 for road maintenance for all future years, with a provision for adjustment not to exceed the cost of living as determined by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) prepared by the US Bureau of Labor Statistics as appropriate, be adopted.”', '“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of ## Blanchard Estates Zone of Benefit, California, Measure J, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $1,000.00 on each parcel of land within the Blanchard Estates Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road, drainage, and landscape maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $12,000.00, be adopted?”
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Cavalry Meadows Zone of Benefit, California, Measure L, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $350.00 on each parcel of land within the Cavalry Meadows Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for drainage maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $3,850.00, to replace the current benefit assessment of $110, be adopted?”
## El Dorado Hills Community Services District, California, Measure Q, Repeal Promontory Park Landscaping and Lighting Assessment District No. 22 Measure (November 2024)
“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 22 and refund levied special assessments?”
## El Dorado Hills Community Services District, California, Measure R, Repeal Valley View Landscaping and Lighting Assessment District No. 33 Measure (November 2024)
“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 33 and refund levied special assessments?”
## El Dorado Hills Community Services District, California, Measure S, Repeal Carson Creek Park Landscaping and Lighting Assessment District No. 39 Measure (November 2024)
“Shall the El Dorado Hills Community Services District repeal Landscape and Lighting District No. 39 and refund levied special assessments?”
## Emerald Meadows Zone of Benefit, California, Measure K, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $375.00, with an annual adjustment using the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers, on each parcel of land within the Emerald Meadows Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for drainage, street lighting, landscape maintenance, and wetland-related services and generating an annual revenue of approximately $41,625.00, be adopted?”
## Hickok Road Community Services District, California, Measure T, Parcel Tax Increase for Road Maintenance Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure increasing the per parcel Hickok Road CSD special tax limit from $200 to $400 per year, resulting in a maximum annual income of $24,800 for road maintenance for all future years, with a provision for adjustment not to exceed the cost of living as determined by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) prepared by the US Bureau of Labor Statistics as appropriate, be adopted.”
## King of the Mountain Zone of Benefit, California, Measure H, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $550.00 on each parcel of land within the King of the Mountain Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road improvements and maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $11,550.00, to replace the current benefit assessment of $250, be adopted?”
## Pilot View Zone of Benefit, California, Measure G, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $400.00 on each parcel of land within the Pilot View Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road improvements and maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $28,800.00, be adopted?”
## River Pines Zone of Benefit, California, Measure B, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $500.00 on each parcel of land within the River Pines Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road improvements and maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $47,000.00, to replace the current benefit assessment of $275, be adopted?”
## Ryan Ranch Zone of Benefit, California, Measure E, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $1,000.00 on each parcel of land within the Ryan Ranch Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road improvements and maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $81,000.00, be adopted?”
## Sundown Estates Zone of Benefit, California, Measure M, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $350.00 on each parcel of land within the Sundown Estates Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for drainage maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $3,500.00, to replace the current benefit assessment of $100, be adopted?”
## Walnut Drive Road Zone of Benefit, California, Measure C, Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the measure to levy an annual special tax in an amount of $685.00 on each parcel of land within the Walnut Drive Zone of Benefit commencing fiscal year 2025/2026 and continuing for an unlimited duration, to be used only for road improvements and maintenance and generating an annual revenue of approximately $51,375, to replace the current benefit assessment of $325, be adopted?”
